intro: Sisymbrium runawurense, commonly known as the Runawurra devil's-bit, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Australia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss through transpiration.
